intro: Typhonium muaklekense, commonly known as the Malay arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix and spathe. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its underground tubers are edible and have a starchy texture similar to taro. Typhonium muaklekense thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
